entities.name: Subcutaneous fat necrosis of the newborn
Pruritic urticarial papules and plaques of pregnancy (PUPPP)

Head and neck anatomy (skin tension lines; cosmetic subunits and junction lines; free margins of eyelids, lips, helices, nostrils; SMAS; muscles of facial expression; vascular anatomy—carotid systems, facial/Angular artery; nerve anatomy—facial and trigeminal; surgical “danger zones” including Erb's point, temporal and marginal mandibular branches)
Nail anatomy (nail unit components—plate, matrix, bed, hyponychium, folds; embryology/development; vascular and nerve supply)
Healing by intention (primary, second, tertiary/delayed primary)
Factors affecting healing (local—depth, infection, blood supply; systemic—nutrition, medications, chronic illness)
Local anesthetics (amides, esters), additives (epinephrine, sodium bicarbonate, hyaluronidase), tumescent anesthesia
Techniques (local infiltration, field blocks, nerve blocks—digital, facial, hand, foot)
Complications (lidocaine toxicity, vasovagal reactions, allergic reactions)
Sterilization methods (steam autoclave, chemical, dry heat, gas)
Antibiotic prophylaxis (indications for endocarditis, prosthetic joints)
Biopsy techniques (shave/saucerization, punch, excisional—elliptical/disc, incisional, curettage, snip)
Specimen handling and transport (formalin, Michel's medium, fresh tissue)
Needle types (taper, conventional cutting, reverse cutting)
Suturing techniques (simple interrupted, running, dermal/subcuticular, mattress, pulley, running locked)
Alternatives (staples, skin closure tapes, tissue adhesives—cyanoacrylate)
Excisional surgery (elliptical excision for carcinomas, melanoma, cysts)
Mohs micrographic surgery (indications—high-risk, tissue conservation; fresh-frozen technique; mapping; immunohistochemical stains)
Cryosurgery (liquid nitrogen; freeze–thaw cycles; cotton tip/open spray/closed probe)
Flap surgery (advancement, rotation, transposition, interpolation; rhombic, bilobed, Rieger, Abbé, paramedian forehead; tension vectors/pivot point; complications—necrosis, hematoma, trapdoor)
Skin grafting (full-thickness, split-thickness, Burow's graft; imbibition, inosculation, neovascularization; donor site selection; complications)
Specialized grafts (composite grafts; free cartilage grafts)
Wound dressings (occlusive/moisture-retentive/non-adherent; films, hydrocolloids, hydrogels, foams, alginates, biologics)
Laser physics and selective photothermolysis (chromophores—melanin, hemoglobin, water, tattoo ink; thermal relaxation time)
Non-ablative and fractional lasers for rejuvenation
Vascular lasers (pulsed dye, Nd:YAG) for vascular lesions
Neurotoxins (onabotulinumtoxinA, abobotulinumtoxinA, etc.; mechanism; cosmetic—glabellar/crow's/forehead; medical—hyperhidrosis)
Soft-tissue fillers (hyaluronic acid, calcium hydroxyapatite, poly-L-lactic acid, PMMA, autologous fat; vascular occlusion/nodule management)
Chemical peels (superficial/medium/deep; glycolic, salicylic, Jessner's, TCA, phenol)
Management of tattoo and body piercing complications
Dermatofibroma (aneurysmal, fibrous histiocytoma, sclerosing angioma variants)
Giant Cell Tumor of Tendon Sheath

Lichenoid: Benign Lichenoid Keratosis; Lichen Nitidus; Lichen Planopilaris; Lichen Planus (LP); Lichenoid Drug Reaction; Lichen Sclerosus et Atrophicus (LS\&A); Lichen Striatus; Secondary Syphilis (Lues)

Vacuolar: Acute–Subacute Lupus (SCLE); Chronic Discoid Lupus (DLE); Dermatomyositis; Erythema Multiforme (EM); Fixed Drug Reaction; Graft-Versus-Host Disease (GVHD); Pityriasis Lichenoides et Varioliformis Acuta (PLEVA)
Subcorneal/Intragranular split: Bullous Impetigo; Pemphigus Erythematosus; Pemphigus foliaceus; Staphylococcal Scalded Skin Syndrome (SSSS)
Intraepidermal/acantholytic: Darier’s Disease; Grover's Disease; Hailey-Hailey Disease; Herpes Simplex; Pemphigus Vulgaris; Warty Dyskeratoma

Subepidermal split: Bullous Pemphigoid/Herpes Gestationis; Bullous Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (BSLE); Coma Blister; Dermatitis Herpetiformis (DH); Epidermolysis Bullosa Acquisita (EBA); Linear IgA Bullous Dermatosis; Porphyria Cutanea Tarda (PCT); Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis (TEN)
Glucagonoma/Acrodermatitis Enteropathica; Guttate Psoriasis; Lichen Simplex Chronicus; Pityriasis Rosea; Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris (PRP); Psoriasis; Seborrheic dermatitis
Vasculitis: Cryoglobulinemia; Erythema Induratum/Nodular Vasculitis; Leukocytoclastic Vasculitis (LCV); Polyarteritis Nodosa (PAN)
Other vascular reactions: Erythema Annulare Centrifugum; Pernio (Chilblains); Pigmented Purpuric Dermatosis (PPD); Polymorphous Light Eruption (PMLE); Stasis Dermatitis
Palisading granulomas: Granuloma Annulare (GA); Necrobiosis Lipoidica Diabeticorum (NLD); Rheumatoid Nodule
Suppurative granulomas: Deep fungal infections (Blastomycosis, Coccidioidomycosis); Granulomatous Rosacea/Lupus Miliaris
Foreign body granulomas: Keratin Granuloma; Suture Granuloma
Other: Granuloma Faciale; Interstitial Granuloma Annulare; Jessner’s Lymphocytic Infiltrate; Lepromatous Leprosy; Leishmaniasis; Necrobiotic Xanthogranuloma (NXG); Reticulohistiocytic Granuloma
α1-Antitrypsin Deficiency Panniculitis; Erythema Nodosum; Lupus Profundus; Pancreatic Fat Necrosis; Sclerosing Panniculitis; Subcutaneous Fat Necrosis of the Newborn
Actinomycosis; Botryomycosis; Chromoblastomycosis; Cryptococcus; Orf/Cowpox; Scabies; Sporotrichosis; Tinea (Corporis, Nigra, Versicolor)
Morphea/Scleroderma; Radiation Dermatitis; Reactive Perforating Collagenosis
